page.title: 16Farming,Llanddulas area
page.content: There are very few farms in the Llanddulas area.Infact there are only five.Three are Mill Street,Beulah Avenue,and Tan-yr-Ogo.Two of the farms are mentioned in the 18th century parish registers. There are two old farmhouses in Llanddulas which are not classed as farms, but are ordinary houses.They are Bron-y-Wendon and TY-Ucha.The farm in Mill Street is called Y Felin which means the Mill and is owned by Mr. Cross.There used to be a water mill here.The farm in Beulah Avenue is called Bryn-Dulas.Mr.Ray owns owns a farm in Beulah Avenue which is called Bryn-Dulas.There used to be farms in Llanddulas,but many have been knocked down.Some farmers went to work in the quarry but some work in Colwyn Bay.
